professional_bio: I am an enthusiastic, curious and highly motivated engineer (MSc) with a strong passion for ADAS, Deep Learning, and Computer Vision.

My masterâ€™s thesis investigated Explainable AI for deep reinforcement learning-based autonomous driving, demonstrating that TD3 can outperform other algorithms while offering human-interpretable decisions.

My tech stack includes Python, Linux, OpenCV, FFmpeg, Flask/FastAPI, PyTorch, Docker, Kubernetes, and various cloud platforms. I believe in writing clean, maintainable code and documenting everything thoroughly.

Deployed scalable Flask + Docker APIs and FFMPEG pipelines that generate personalised videos. Built Selenium/BeautifulSoup data-ingestion crawler and MySQL schema. Author semi-annually TÃœBÄ°TAK progress reports and present results to executive and academic boards. Co-author journal and conference papers disseminating R&D results

Worked on predicting urinary incontinence in children using wristband data (pulse, movement) and diaper wetness measurements. Implemented in C++ and Python, utilizing SciPy library, ESP32, and ANT devices. Drafted periodic Teknopark progress reports and proactively tracked the preparation and submission of detailed monthly R&D updates.
Specialized in ADAS, Deep Learning, XAI research.

thesis.title: Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) for Deep Reinforcement Learning Based Autonomous Driving
thesis.description: TD3 out-performed PPO/DDPG in TORCS; SHAP validated human-like behaviour.

timeline.description: Member of Alatay Mobil Autonomous Team. Developed autonomous vehicle for Robotaxi Passenger Autonomous Vehicle Competition at Teknofest. Focused on image processing and computer vision.

thesis.title: Image-Processing-Based Real-Time Lane Detection & Tracking for Autonomous Vehicles.
thesis.description: Developed a real-time lane detection system using OpenCV and Python with AirSim and Unreal Engine 4, achieving high accuracy across various lighting and weather conditions.
